section.name: WOLips
section.p: download install wizards manipulating the build process bugs and known issues inside WOLips

subsection.name: What you need
subsection.p: In the case you are on a Mac: 10.2.*.
JDK 1.3.1 to launch Eclipse, otherwise you can not use the wizards. You can use 1.4.1 to develop.

subsection.name: Expand
subsection.p: Expand com.objectstyle.wolips_*.*.*.tar.gz. The expanded folder contains 3 subfolder and this document.
The features folder contains 1 feature. There are two plugins in the plugins. The stuff folder may be empty.

subsection.name: Install
subsection.p: Copy the content of the features folder in the Eclipse features folder and the content of the plugins folder in the Eclipse plugins folder.
On the Mac right click on Eclipse.app. Select show package contents. Navigate to Contens/Resources/Java
On Windows the feature and plugins are located in the same folder as the Eclipse.exe.

subsection.name: Mac
subsection.p: Replace the Info.plist with the one from the stuff folder. (Ctrl click on the App and select show package Contents)
Replace the Eclipse file in the folder Contents/MacOS with /System/Library/Frameworks/JavaVM.framework/Versions/A/Resources/MacOS/JavaApplicationStub
Take care that there is only the new JavaApplicationStub renamed to Eclipse in your MacOS folder. No other files! Otherwise you won`t be able to launch or debug in Eclipse

subsection.name: Update
subsection.p: Please reset the WOLips perspective after an update.

subsection.name: How to proceed
subsection.p: It's normal that you have to launch Eclipse.app twice after changes to the plugins and features.
The update manager should occur. Please activate. On the mac say when Eclipse ask to relaunch and quit restart the application by hand.On other platforms just say yes.
If the welcome to WOLips doesn't open you can view the welcome under Help->Welcome.
